page.title: 04BLACKMORE VALE MIXED FARMING
page.content: The only line of communication is Wat- erloo Lane,now surfaced,which joins the A357 Stalbridge-Sturminster road. Caundle Brook flows WtoE in the south. 100 breeding ewes are on the enclosed rough grazing meadows;the better grass -lands northwards being used for dairy and beef herds.New ventures;an acre of vines produces 1400 bottles white wine annually;3 man-made ponds provide pond weed retailed countrywide. There are neither retired people nor children here.A private bus service runs Shillingstone-Yeovil. All households have a car.Some work locally,others commute outside as teachers or secretaries. The area is well-farmed,tidy and all the fields are used for good returns. Some folk are reluctant to talk of their farms or their work but they are happy with their way of life.
